Module jGame
Package jGame.core.ui.hud

Class UIHudButtonElement

java.lang.Object
jGame.core.ui.hud.UIHudElement
jGame.core.ui.hud.UIHudButtonElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
UIHudCheckBoxElement
public class UIHudButtonElement
extends UIHudElement
This class represents a "clickable" element rendered on the screen, that could respond to user input.
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
Nuno Pereira

  • Constructor Details

    • UIHudButtonElement

      protected UIHudButtonElement()

    • UIHudButtonElement

      public UIHudButtonElement​(int x, int y, int width, int height, java.lang.String textToDisplay)
      Initializes this button element in the given x and y coordinates and with the given width and height dimensions. Also sets the string to be displayed in the center of the button.
      Parameters:
      x - the horizontal position of this element
      y - the vertical position of this element
      width - the width of this element
      height - the height of this element
      textToDisplay - the text to be displayed by this element
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • UIHudButtonElement

      public UIHudButtonElement​(int x, int y, int width, int height, java.lang.String textToDisplay, int constraintSpecs, int[] constraintValues)
      Initializes this button element in the given x and y coordinates and with the given width and height dimensions. Also sets the string to be displayed in the center of the button.
      Parameters:
      x - the horizontal position of this element
      y - the vertical position of this element
      width - the width of this element
      height - the height of this element
      textToDisplay - the text to be displayed by this element
      constraintSpecs - the constraints to apply
      constraintValues - the values of the applied constraints
      Since:
      1.0.0

    • processClick

      protected void processClick​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Processes a mouse click. The default implementation does nothing, so this method should be overridden.
      Parameters:
      e - the mouse event to be processed
      Since:
      1.0.0
